result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad David Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad David Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad David Anderson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today January 26, 2016 by 4:30 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF225.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Mr. Seekamp.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant may have contact with Mary Zezza.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Drug Court will be considered as ATR.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Chad David Anderson appeared from jail. Includes 14CF224, 14CF225 and 15CF215. Case called at 2:34 pm. Parties have rec'd a copy of PSI. ADA Minser makes recommendations. Atty Kemp makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court questions. Court orders: 
On 14CF224 and 15CF225 - 4 yrs probation w/h. 
- 9 months Jail STAYED
 each on 14CF224 and 14CF225
- Court Costs $253.00 on 14CF224 and $253.00 on 14CF225 
- One DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA
 within 30 Days
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Not to possess a firearm
- No Contact with Mr. Seecamp. 
- Not to be associated with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing, or manufacturing of illegal or mood altering substances. Defendant may have contact with M. Zezza.
- Sign up for probation today by 4:30 pm
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Drug Court to be considered as ATR
Defendant is entitled to 204 days credit under 973.155.
Probation review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 04:30 pm.

On 15CF214 - 2 yrs I/S probation. 
- I/S 9 months jail 
- $243.00 - Court Costs.

Probation to run concurrent

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Chad David Anderson appeared from jail. Includes 14CF224, 14CF225, 15CF214, 15CF477, 15TR2031, 15TR2032. Case called at 2:45 pm. There is an agreement. ADA Minser recites. The state files an amended information in 14CF224.  No objection from Atty Kemp.   Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one in 14CF224, Count one in 14CF225 and Count three to 15CF214, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended Count one in 14CF224, Count one in 14CF225 and Count three in 15CF214. All remaining charges and files are dismissed. Court orders PSI. Bonds continue. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
